Q.1. WHAT IS YOUR RANK*  1. CAPTAIN 2. 1ST LIEUTENANT 3. 2ND LIEUTENANT 0. NO ANSWER

Q.2. HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN IN YOUR PRESENT RANK*  0. NO ANSWER 1. 3 MONTHS OR LESS 2. OVER 3 MONTHS UP TO 6 MONTHS 3. OVER 6 MONTHS UP TO 9 MONTHS 4. OVER 9 MONTHS UP TO 1 YEAR 5. OVER 1 YEAR UP TO 2 YEARS 6. OVER 2 YEARS
Q.3. ARE YOU:  1. SINGLE 2. MARRIED AND HAVE NO CHILDREN 3. MARRIED AND DO HAVE CHILDREN 4. WIDOWED, DIVORCED, OR SEPARATED

Q.4. HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN OVERSEAS* E. FOR NATIONAL GUARD TROOPS THIS MEANS ACTIVE SERVICE.  1. SIX MONTHS OR LESS 2. MORE THAN 6 MONTHS BUT NOT OVER 1 YEAR 3. MORE THAN 1 YEAR BUT NOT OVER 1 1/2 YEARS 4. MORE THAN 1 1/2 YEARS

Q.5. WHAT MONTH AND YEAR DID YOU JOIN THIS DIVISION* E. MONTH:  01. JANUARY 02. FEBRUARY 03. MARCH 04. APRIL 05. MAY 06. JUNE 07. JULY 08. AUGUST 09. SEPTEMBER 10. OCTOBER 11. NOVEMBER 12. DECEMBER E. YEAR:
Q.5. WHAT MONTH AND YEAR DID YOU JOIN THIS DIVISION* E. MONTH:  26 1. 1940 OR EARLIER 36 2. 1941 185 3. 1942 20 4. 1943 0 5. 1944 X. QUESTION 6A NOT CODED.

Q.6B. ABOUT HOW MANY DAYS ALTOGETHER, HAVE YOU BEEN IN COMBAT NOT COUNTING THE DAYS YOU,VE SPENT BACK OF THE LINE OR AWAY FROM THE FRONT*  ANP (ACTUAL NUMBER DAYS) 003. 3 DAYS . . . 252. 252 DAYS 000. NONE 999.NO ANSWER X. QUESTIONS 6C AND 6D NOT CODED.

Q.7. WHAT BRANCH OF THE ARMY ARE YOU IN NOW*  01. ENGINEERS 02. FIELD ARTILLERY 03. QUARTERMASTER CORPS 04. INFANTRY 05. MEDICAL DEPARTMENT 06. ARMORED FORCE 07. SIGNAL CORPS 08. COAST ARTILLERY AND ANTI-AIRCRAFT 09. AIR CORPS 10. TRANSPORTATION CORPS 11. ORDNANCE DEPARTMENT 12. CHEMICAL WARFARE SERVICE 13. MILITARY POLICE 14. OTHER

Q.8. IF YOU HAD A CHOICE, WHICH ONE OF THESE BRANCHES OF THE ARMY WOULD YOU LIKE TO BE IN*  01. ENGINEERS 02. FIELD ARTILLERY 03. QUARTERMASTER CORPS 04. INFANTRY 05. MEDICAL DEPARTMENT 06. ARMORED FORCE 07. SIGNAL CORPS 08. COAST ARTILLERY AND ANTI-AIRCRAFT 09. AIR CORPS 10. TRANSPORTATION CORPS 11. ORDNANCE DEPARTMENT 12. CHEMICAL WARFARE SERVICE 13. MILITARY POLICE 14. ALL OTHERS 00. NO ANSWER
Q.9A. ARE YOU:  1. A LINE OFFICER 2. A STAFF OFFICER 0. NO ANSWER
Q.9B. IF YOU HAD A CHANCE TO CHOOSE WOULD YOU RATHER BE A LINE OFFICER OR A STAFF OFFICER*  1. RATHER BE A STAFF OFFICER 2. RATHER BE A LINE OFFICER 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER
Q.9C. WHO HAVE THE BETTER CHANCE FOR PROMOTION*  1. LINE OFFICERS 2. STAFF OFFICERS 3. ABOUT THE SAME 0. NO ANSWER

Q.9D. HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT THE COMPARATIVE PROMOTION OPPORTUNITIES OF LINE OFFICERS AND STAFF OFFICERS*  1. I THINK THE PRESENT PRACTICE IS O.K. 2. I THINK THE PRESENT PRACTICE IS SOMEWHAT UNFAIR 3. I THINK THE PRESENT PRACTICE IS VERY UNFAIR 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTION 10 NOT CODED.
Q.11. HOW MUCH OF THE TIME YOU WERE IN COMBAT WERE YOU A MEMBER OF THE COMPANY YOU ARE NOW IN*  1. ALL OR MOST OF THE TIME 2. SOME OF THE TIME 3. LITTLE OR NONE OF THE TIME 0. NO ANSWER

Q.12. ABOUT HOW MANY BATTLE CASUALTIES (KILLED AND WOUNDED) HAS YOUR PRESENT COMPANY HAD SINCE YOU FIRST WENT INTO COMBAT WITH IT*  1. MORE THAN HALF OF THE MEN HAVE BEEN CASUALTIES 2. BETWEEN A QUARTER AND A HALF HAVE BEEN CASUALTIES 3. LESS THAN A QUARTER HAVE BEEN CASUALTIES 4. DON,T KNOW 0. NO ANSWER

Q.13. IN GENERAL, HOW WOULD YOU SAY YOU FEEL MOST OF THE TIME, IN GOOD SPIRITS OR IN LOW SPIRITS*  1. I AM USUALLY IN GOOD SPIRITS 2. I AM IN GOOD SPIRITS SOME OF THE TIME AND IN LOW SPIRITS SOME OF THE TIME 3. I AM USUALLY IN LOW SPIRITS

Q.14. HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF THE RIFLEMAN,S JOB IN MODERN BATTLE*  1. MORE IMPORTANT THAN MOST ANY OTHER SOLDIER,S JOB 2. IMPORTANT, BUT NO MORE SO THAN MANY OTHERS 3. NOT VERY IMPORTANT COMPARED WITH WHAT OTHER SOLDIERS CAN DO 0. NO ANSWER
Q.15. WHAT SORT OF TEAMWORK DID THE MEN IN YOUR COMPANY SHOW IN ACTUAL BATTLE*  1. VERY GOOD 2. FAIRLY GOOD 3. NOT VERY GOOD 4. NOT GOOD AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER
Q.16. DO YOU USUALLY FEEL THAT WHAT YOU ARE DOING IN THE ARMY IS WORTHWHILE OR NOT*  1. I USUALLY FEEL IT IS WORTHWHILE 2. I USUALLY FEEL IT IS NOT WORTHWHILE 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER
Q.17. WHEN YOU WERE FIGHTING IN A PARTICULAR BATTLE, DID YOU EVER HAVE THE FEELING THAT IT WASN,T WORTH THE COST*  1. YES, ALMOST ALWAYS 2. YES, SOMETIMES 3. NO, NEVER 4. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

Q.18. WHILE YOU WERE AT THE BATTLE FRONT, DID YOUR LEADERS EXPLAIN THE WHOLE BATTLE SO YOU COULD SEE JUST HOW YOUR COMPANY,S PART FITTED INTO THE CAMPAIGN AS A WHOLE*  1. AS MUCH AS THEY COULD 2. THEY COULD HAVE GIVEN US A LITTLE MORE 3. THEY COULD HAVE GIVEN US A GREAT DEAL MORE 0. NO ANSWER

Q.19. WHILE YOU WERE IN COMBAT, DID YOU FEEL THAT THE TROOPS IN THE REAR, IN GENERAL, WERE DOING AS MUCH AS THEY COULD UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES, FOR THE MEN WHO WERE DOING THE FIGHTING*  1. AS MUCH AS THEY COULD 2. COULD HAVE DONE SOMEWHAT MORE 3. COULD HAVE DONE A GREAT DEAL MORE 0. NO ANSWER

Q.20. DID YOU RECEIVE ANY OF THE FOLLOWING DECORATIONS*  1. PURPLE HEART 2. SILVER STAR 3. DISTINGUISHED SERVICE CROSS 4. PURPLE HEART AND SILVER STAR 5. PURPLE HEART AND DISTINGUISHED SERVICE CROSS 6. SILVER STAR AND DISTINGUISHED SERVICE CROSS 7. PURPLE HEART, SILVER STAR AND DISTINGUISHED SERVICE CROSS 8. NONE OF THE THREE (PURPLE HEART, SILVER STAR, DISTINGUISHED SERVICE CROSS) 0. NO ANSWER

Q.21A. HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT THE WAY IN WHICH THE SILVER STAR IS AWARDED TO ENLISTED MEN*  1. ALL MEN I KNOW WHO GOT THEM REALLY DESERVED THEM 2. A FEW MEN I KNOW WHO GOT THEM DID NOT DESERVE THEM 3. MANY MEN I KNOW WHO GOT THEM DID NOT DESERVE THEM 0. NO ANSWER

Q.21B. DO YOU KNOW ANY ENLISTED MEN WHO DESERVED SILVER STARS BUT DID NOT GET THEM*  1. MANY MEN I KNOW DESERVED SILVER STARS BUT DID NOT GET THEM 2. A FEW MEN I KNOW DESERVED SILVER STARS BUT DID NOT GET THEM 3. NOBODY I KNOW DESERVED A SILVER STAR BUT DID NOT GET IT 0. NO ANSWER

Q.22. IN GENERAL WOULD YOU SAY THAT BATTLE FIGHTING BECAME MORE FRIGHTENING OR LESS FRIGHTENING THE MORE YOU SAW OF IT*  1. IT WAS MORE FRIGHTENING THE MORE I SAW OF IT 2. IT WAS LESS FRIGHTENING THE MORE I SAW OF IT 3. IT WAS NEVER FRIGHTENING 4. IT STAYED FRIGHTENING ALL THE TIME 0. NO ANSWER X. CODES 01-04 PRECODED ON QUESTIONNAIRE, OTHER RESPONSES VOLUNTEERED.

Q.23. WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING STATEMENTS BEST TELLS THE WAY YOU WOULD FEEL ABOUT GOING BACK INTO ACTUAL BATTLE*  01. I WANT VERY MUCH TO GET INTO IT AS SOON AS POSSIBLE 02. I AM READY TO GO ANYTIME 03. I HOPE I WON,T HAVE TO GO BUT IF I GO I THINK I WILL DO ALL RIGHT 04. I HOPE I WON,T HAVE TO GO BECAUSE I DON,T THINK I WOULD DO VERY WELL 05. HAVE DONE MY SHARE, LET OTHERS FIGHT 06. NEED A REST OR FURLOUGH FIRST 07. COULDN,T STAND IT, AFRAID, NERVES SHOT 08. PHYSICAL CONDITION 09. QUALIFIED ACCEPTANCE 10. REFUSAL (MISCELLANEOUS) 11. ALL OTHER 00. NO ANSWER
Q.24. ARE YOU EVER WORRIED AND UPSET*  1. I AM HARDLY EVER WORRIED AND UPSET 2. I AM SOMETIMES WORRIED AND UPSET 3. I AM OFTEN WORRIED AND UPSET
Q.25. IN GENERAL, WHAT SORT OF A TIME DO YOU HAVE IN THE ARMY*  1. I HAVE A PRETTY GOOD TIME 2. IT,S ABOUT FIFTY-FIFTY 3. I HAVE A PRETTY ROTTEN TIME 0. NO ANSWER

Q.26A. DO YOU THINK THAT THE EQUIPMENT OF THE AMERICAN ARMY IS BETTER OR WORSE THAN THE EQUIPMENT OF THE JAPANESE ARMY*  1. ALL OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS BETTER 2. MOST OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS BETTER 3. OUR EQUIPMENT IS ABOUT THE SAME AS THAT OF THE JAPANESE ARMY 4. MOST OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS WORSE 5. ALL OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS WORSE 6. DON,T KNOW
Q.26B. IF YOU THINK SOME JAPANESE WEAPONS ARE BETTER THAN OURS WHAT ARE THEY*  1. NO JAPANESE WEAPONS ARE BETTER THAN OURS 2. SOME JAPANESE WEAPONS ARE BETTER THAN OURS 0. NO ANSWER

Q.27. THINK OF ALL THE MEN IN YOUR PLATOON (OR EQUIVALENT UNIT) JUST BEFORE YOU WENT INTO ACTION FOR THE FIRST TIME. NOW THINK OF THE ONE MAN WHO HAD SERVED TIME THE MOST IN THE GUARDHOUSE. HOW DID HE DO IN ACTUAL BATTLE AS COMPARED WITH OTHER MEN IN THE PLATOON*  1. HE DID MUCH BETTER THAN AVERAGE 2. HE DID BETTER THAN AVERAGE 3. SAME AS AVERAGE 4. HE DID WORSE THAN AVERAGE 5. HE DID MUCH WORSE THAN AVERAGE 6. ANY OTHER ANSWER 0. NO ANSWER

Q.28. HOW MANY OF THE NON-COMS IN YOUR OUTFIT ARE THE KIND YOU WOULD WANT SERVING UNDER YOU IN COMBAT*  1. ALL OF THEM ARE 2. MOST OF THEM ARE 3. ABOUT HALF OF THEM ARE 4. FEW OF THEM ARE 5. NONE OF THEM ARE 0. NO ANSWER

Q.29. IF SOME OF THE NON-COMS YOU HAVE ARE NOT THE KIND YOU WOULD WANT IN COMBAT, WHY HAVEN,T YOU REPLACED THEM*  1. ALL OF THEM ARE THE KIND I WOULD WANT IN COMBAT 2. NO BETTER MEN ARE AVAILABLE 3. I DON,T HAVE AUTHORITY TO CHANGE THEM MYSELF 4. I DON,T WANT TO BREAK PRESENT NON-COMS AND CAN,T TRANSFER THEM OUT 5. SOME OTHER REASON 0. NO ANSWER

Q.30A. HOW MANY OF THE OFFICERS IN YOUR COMPANY (OR BATTERY) ARE THE KIND YOU WOULD WANT TO SERVE WITH IN COMBAT*  1. ALL OF THEM ARE 2. MOST OF THEM ARE 3. ABOUT HALF OF THEM ARE 4. FEW OF THEM ARE 5. NONE OF THEM ARE 0. NO ANSWER

Q.38. DID SUPPLIES YOU MUCH WANTED OR NEEDED AT THE FRONT EVER FAIL TO REACH YOU*  1. WE USUALLY GOT WHAT WE NEEDED 2. WE OFTEN DID NOT GET WHAT WE NEEDED 3. WE SELDOM GOT WHAT WE NEEDED 0. NO ANSWER

Q.39. HAVE YOU LISTENED TO RADIO TOKYO* IF YES, HOW DID YOU FEEL ABOUT THE RADIO PROPAGANDA*  1. YES, MOSTLY LIES 2. YES, MOSTLY LIES, BUT MAYBE A LITTLE MORE TRUTH THAN WE CARE TO ADMIT 3. YES, A LOT OF TRUTH IN WHAT THEY SAID 4. YES, NO ANSWER 5. NO

Q.40A. WHAT WOULD YOU LIKE TO SEE HAPPEN TO THE JAPANESE AFTER THE WAR*  1. PUNISH THE LEADERS, BUT NOT THE ORDINARY JAPANESE 2. MAKE THE ORDINARY JAPANESE PEOPLE SUFFER PLENTY 3. WIPE OUT THE WHOLE JAPANESE NATION 0. NO ANSWER

Q.40B. WHAT WOULD YOU LIKE TO SEE HAPPEN TO THE GERMANS AFTER THE WAR*  1. PUNISH THE LEADERS, BUT NOT THE ORDINARY GERMAN 2. MAKE THE ORDINARY GERMAN PEOPLE SUFFER PLENTY 3. WIPE OUT THE WHOLE GERMAN NATION 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTION 41 NOT CODED.

Q.44. IN YOUR OPINION, WHAT SHOULD BE DONE WITH MEN WHO CRACK UP IN ACTION, THAT IS, MEN WHO GET SHELL-SHOCKED, BLOW THEIR TOPS, GO HAYWIRE*  1. MOST OF THEM SHOULD BE TREATED AS SICK MEN 2. MOST OF THEM SHOULD BE TREATED AS COWARDS AND PUNISHED 3. MOST OF THEM SHOULD BE TREATED SOME OTHER WAY 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTIONS 45A, 45B AND 46 NOT CODED.

Q.47A. WHEN THE GOING WAS TOUGH, HOW MUCH DID IT HELP YOU TO THINK THAT YOU HAD TO FINISH THE JOB IN ORDER TO GET HOME AGAIN*  1. IT HELPED A LOT 2. IT HELPED SOME 3. IT HELPED A LITTLE 4. IT DID NOT HELP AT ALL 5. I DIDN,T THINK OF IT 0. NO ANSWER

Q.47B. WHEN THE GOING WAS TOUGH, HOW MUCH DID IT HELP YOU TO THINK THAT YOU COULDN,T LET THE OTHER MEN DOWN*  1. IT HELPED A LOT 2. IT HELPED SOME 3. IT HELPED A LITTLE 4. IT DID NOT HELP AT ALL 5. I DIDN,T THINK OF IT 0. NO ANSWER

Q.47C. WHEN THE GOING WAS TOUGH, HOW MUCH DID IT HELP YOU TO THINK OF WHAT WE ARE FIGHTING FOR*  1. IT HELPED A LOT 2. IT HELPED SOME 3. IT HELPED A LITTLE 4. IT DID NOT HELP AT ALL 5. I DIDN,T THINK OF IT 0. NO ANSWER

Q.47D. WHEN THE GOING WAS TOUGH, HOW MUCH WERE YOU HELPED BY THOUGHTS OF HATRED FOR THE ENEMY*  1. THEY HELPED A LOT 2. THEY HELPED SOME 3. THEY HELPED A LITTLE 4. THEY DID NOT HELP AT ALL 5. I DIDN,T HAVE SUCH THOUGHTS 0. NO ANSWER

Q.47E. WHEN THE GOING WAS TOUGH, HOW MUCH DID PRAYER HELP YOU*  1. IT HELPED A LOT 2. IT HELPED SOME 3. IT HELPED A LITTLE 4. IT DID NOT HELP AT ALL 5. I DIDN,T THINK OF IT 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTIONS 48A AND 48B NOT CODED.
